name: matt geiken
text: We had dinner hear last night. Sushi was very good and well priced. They even have several dishes and special rolls for kids. The bartender was also our waitress and she was very polite and friendly. We would definite definitely go again next time we are in town.

name: Daniel Pendley
text: Great sushi- $1.25 for 3 pieces on Mondays. Great menu all around. Lunch is good deal. Some of the best Thai food in town and some very tasty pan Asian options! Wine special on Thursdays

name: ian kornmeyer
text:
Asian Rim was across from our hotel and we thought we'd give it a try.  Overall, I'm glad we went and we would go back.

We tried the fish tacos and some sushi.  The fish tacos come thoroughly doused in coleslaw and big enough to be difficult to eat without a double-jointed jaw. They were full of fresh veggies and the fish was good.  The sushi was a Rainbow Roll and some nigiri.  The fish was all fresh and the portions were appropriate for the price.

Our sweet tea came out hot enough to melt the included ice.

name: Lee Osbourn
text: If you've never eaten at Asian Rim, grab your keys and head over there!  It's a great little place with a nice atmosphere and the staff are very friendly. I usually have the Dragon's tail(i think its called). I always like to try something different when i go,  but I've never been disappointed.

name: Paige H.
text: Asian Rim is our favorite place in Birmingham, AL. They have a wide variety of delicious food where I can enjoy Thai or Sushi and my husband can delight in a juicy steak. The staff is friendly, the place is upscale casual, and it's a local hotspot near our home. Many out of town diners are pleasantly surprised that this local gem.

name: ninalita84
text: This was certainly a surprise to find in Birmingham!  I used to travel there for business and never let a trip go by without visiting this restaurant.  Their sushi is amazing and I found the service to always be prompt and attentive.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: We stayed at the hotel right next door and saw the reviews of this place and figured we would try it out. We were very disappointed. Food was bland and dried out. Atmosphere was a little weird (the bartender was playing something on her phone from Pandora) that was super strange and not typical of an Asian cuisine restaurant... she seemed a little spacey. I found that when comparing the prices to the quality of the food, it just didn't add up.

name: B R
text: Ive had the worst sushi I've ever tasted here, it's a shame bc we used to love this place. As a military wife we have been all over the country and I have never encountered such awful customer service after voicing my concerns about our meal. They used to be the best but have since gone down hill with the quality of their fish. The owners need to take lessons on customer service and handling criticism professionally with out taking it personally.

name: Spencer Stantis
text: Really great place serving a variety of Asian food. They have something for everyone.

name: Meliah Miranda
text: Asian Rim was FABULOUS!!!  Close to the Drury Inn.  Food was great, service was fantastic. All-in-all, we enjoyed it.

name: Ryan Hanson
text: Great services and delicious sushi. A great place to eat in a really nice restaurant.

name: Anna Harmon
text: Excellent service. Soup was amazing. Sushi was okay, not great.

name: Heather Rowell
text: One of the best dinner experiences.  Peking Duck Rolls, Macadamia Pineapple Sushi,  Salmon and Chocolate Ginger Mousse. Mmm... :)

name: Geralyn Sigler
text: Always a pleasure to eat here! GREAT food, drinks and atmosphere!

name: Parker 205
text: It was a great place but it's now closed

name: Sarah Smith
text: Pretty good Asian restaurant for Birmingham. They have good lunch specials.

name: abbie t
text:
Asian Rim, specifically the manager Colton, turned what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my family into a three hour nightmare. It was failure after failure, and I have never before been subjected to such poor customer service.  That’s the short version.

This is the full story. I ordered (and paid for) delivery from Asian Rim through Yelp Eat24 and, after waiting an hour and a half without getting any food or as much as a phone call, I called the restaurant directly to ask when I could expect my meal. I was informed by Colton that there was no order because they don’t associate with Yelp Eat24 at all. Understandably, this freaked me out and lead me to believe I had been scammed. I then called Yelp Eat24 and demanded a refund after telling them what Colton had said. While they did quickly offer a me a refund (which –side note-- I won’t be getting for “up to 5 business days”), they were adamant that they did in fact work with Asian Rim and that their restaurant had actually already confirmed the order before I had called. I was still falsely placing my faith in Asian Rim at this time.

After hanging up with Yelp Eat24, I hurriedly called my bank to inform them that I might have falsely been charged. All of this was quite time consuming and anxiety inducing. On a whim, I decided to call Asian Rim back again and relay to them the information I had been given by the representative at Yelp Eat24 for their own benefit. That’s when Colton then informed me that they did actually work with Yelp Eat24 after all. He just hadn’t known a third party, Backdoor, was also involved and it was their name coming up in his system. He unapologetically told me the food I had originally ordered would be at my house shortly.

But was it? No. So after even more time elapsed, I called Asian Rim a third time to ask what was going on. I was told by a different person that I should “just try calling Backdoor.” I had to flat out demand to be told if the food had at least left Asian Rim yet. She finally said “yeah.” No apologies were given and I was rushed off the phone.

Then I called Backdoor and was told that they did pick up the food from Asian Rim, but then realized the order had been cancelled. Aside from the refund Yelp Eat24 says they will give me, no other amends have even been attempted to be made. To reiterate-- his whole ordeal lasted about 3 hours from the time I placed and paid for the order to the time I was definitively told that there was no food coming. To say this place, and Colton specifically, handled this poorly is an understatement. I adamantly advise everyone reading this to refrain from ordering from Asian Rim.

My wife and I both got FOOD POISONING. Although the owner and company are very kind, aesthetics and food safety are obviously not a concern here. Look for your next meal elsewhere.

name: Matt Smith
text: If you like authentic Thai food than Toi's is were you want to go!  The food is always fresh and extremely flavorful.  The spring rolls are made fresh every morning and are second to none.  I use to eat at this place 2-3 times a week for lunch.  Whenever I am in the Wiregrass, I always try to eat lunch at Toi's.  Stop in and give it a try, you'll be glad you did!!

text: Went for an early lunch around 11 & the food was right off the grill- very fresh & delicious! You can’t beat the value for $7.50. Definitely the place to go for lunch in Daleville! :)

text: Absolutely my most favorite place to eat. They have the best spring rolls on the planet. Let them sit in & soak up the sweet dipping sauce for a couple of minutes & you will be hooked for life. I’m not sure how anyone could leave hungry. Not to mention miss Toi is so sweet and always making sure you have plenty.

text: They have a buffet that they bring out I small portions which ensures the food is fresh.  The owners provide personal service. Consistent and dependable for 13 years.

We don't typically do buffets but this one was good. The food could be a little hotter but all in all the service and food was well above average for the area.

name: CARLOS VICENS

I have no clue why people come here to eat. I gather it's the location. Or they just don't know what good Thai food taste like. Have mercy what a waste of $10.00. Please don't waste your money in this establishment.

text: This is an exceptionally great place!  They bring your straws with little Rose's on top with your drink.  They coconut soup is so very good!  The food was served in a wooden box serving box which was adorable and unique!  The food is absolutely delicious, service was great! Lovely atmosphere!  I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Huntsville area!!

text: Nice clean atmosphere.  They are allowing socially distanced dining inside as well as takeout and curbside  pickup. Everything was very good and the place was very clean. All employees were masked and practicing safety protocols.

name: Samar Misra
text: I thank these amazing, hardworking, patient and supportive staff here.  They always provide tasty, delicious Thai food to variety of people.  I thank them for taking the time to make me vegan or plant based Drunken Noodle lately with no eggs, no fish sauce, no oyster sauce and just tofu and the vegan spring roll and salad was great too.  I apologize to them for ordering at 2:45, forgetting that they close at 3 pm.  I will be sure to keep in mind and order earlier next time.  Once again, they rock and deserve best credit for the hard work they are doing during these times.

name: Kim Dang
text: Really nice staff and delicious food. I love their fried banana. Accidentally ordered late on a Sunday and did not realize they’ve closed and had my food waiting, so they waited for me to pick it up. Awesome prices and would recommend to anyone!

name: Aiden Doan
text: Friendly staffs and good food (recommend drunken noodles, big bowl Tom yum, and red curry.)

name: Sarah Anne
text: Good food and service. Coconut soup is really good. The peanut sauce was better than I expected and went really well with the chicken Satay. Thai tea was good as well. The Pad Thai wasn't my favorite, but it was still good. I liked the spring rolls and chicken panang curry. The salad had a yummy dressing. The California roll wasn't great.

name: Carly Givens
text: Everything I’ve had here has been delicious! Always so happy when I get to eat here. My husband also has enjoyed everything. We will be coming back whenever we can!

name: Cynthia Beaudry
text: So good!!! The service, food, and price were all impeccable. This will be my go-to Thai place from now on!

name: Megan Green
text: My favorite place to go now! They have amazing food! I love their pad thai and drunken chicken noodles!

name: Tomas Salazar
text:
This place is great, price wise and food wise.

Why do I say this you might ask?

Well here is a bullet point list:

-They have lunch specials that are all under 10 dollars including some with shrimp and they won't skimp.

-Outside of the lunch menu the prices are very reasonable.

-Very nice decoration of the place and the waiting staff is all Tai and will treat YOU like a good boi or girl. And will recognize you of you are a regular.

-Flavor is trough the roof and the portions are on the larger size.

Summary, if you like Asian food come over they will treat you very well, serve you fast and you'll then leave feeling like you've spent your time and money well.

name: Jennifer Clay
text: Big Bowl is just happiness. Always good. Love getting Thai Tea with my meal. A banana roll dessert comes with dinner and spring rolls and soup with lunch. Big Bowl is a family favorite with us!

name: angela buchanan
text: Coconut soup is delicious, Pnang curry chicken is fantastic! Comes with ginger dressing for the side salad and two spring rolls, made in house with a honey, chili dipping sauce. Staff was accommodating and very friendly. One of our new favorite spots!!

name: Sergio Flores
text: We order their Pad Thai and Coconut Noodle Soup. Have to say the Pad Thai was great and their soup. Plus they were very fast to get our food ready for us. We order take out.

name: Luis Peralta
text:
This charming restaurant was thoroughly enjoyed by my husband and I. Immediately we were charmed as we appreciate a warm atmosphere.

We both enjoyed our Chicken Pad Thai and Crispy Lemon Chicken.

My husband is now claiming this restaurant for his new favorite go-to.

Thank you for the delicious meal and Happy Holidays!

name: Auburn
text: Delicious! The crispy lemon chicken has to be my favorite along with the spring rolls. They add extra details that truly make dining here a special experience every time.

name: Chris
text:
I'm pleasantly surprised at how much I like this place.

First of all, let me lead with this. It's not going to be the best food you have ever tasted. In fact, I would categorize this as Thai comfort food. When you eat the food here you will feel content because you get good portion sizes at a very low price. And it's good enough to feel happy that you bought it.

I give it 4 stars + 1 because of those those women there is sarcastically hilarious.

name: Rachael Rowe
text: AMAZING! The green curry is my all time favorite.  The ladies are a sheer delight; fabulous service every time. Small but cozy atmosphere.

text: Ordered something called big bowl drunken noodles, was not in a big bowl, place is called big bowl, why is it on a plate. Needs more soup related items for a place called big bowl. Food was average.

1. Their food is amazing and fresh. The Pad Thai, the spring rolls, the chicken with cashew nuts, my kids LOVE the fried rice, the banana spring rolls!! Everything is amazing every time we go.
2. Their service is spot-on, prompt and polite.
3. Prices are very reasonable.
4. I’ve dined in several times and gotten to-go orders as well. Always a great experience.

name: Kevin Breuers
text: Food was easy to order. It was ready and packaged well when I arrived to pick it up. Food was below average. Panang curry was watery and flavorless with no richness that you would expect. Pad thai turned into one big congealed ball of starch. Beef salad beef was overcooked and super tough.  Spring rolls were good. Not sure we will be back.

name: Brandon The Cat
text: Hello Opor! I’m glad your restaurant is doing very well! I don’t know if you will see this, but I’m Arthur, your sister’s son. I’m just using the account I use to make YouTube videos so that is why it probably says “Brandon The Cat. I just searched the name of your restaurant for fun, and I saw many great reviews and more. My favorite dish is the coconut soup, and my favorite beverage is the Thai ice tea! Really good food you are making!

name: Kaylee Walker
text: This is the best Thai place ever. Everything is done to perfection. Even the Thai tea is always perfect!

name: Candace Catlin
text: Everything I had here was delicious and all of the staff were very nice. I'm looking forward to trying more of their dishes.

name: Danielle Walker
text: The staff is always so nice. I LOVE their Coconut Soup! I always order the Pad Thai lunchbox. It comes with soup, salad, and sushi. I have to be honest that the Pad Thai is more on the savory side than I'm used to (I'm used to Pad Thai on the sweeter side), I still order it. Come to think about it, I'll probably order something different next time LOL.

name: Katherine Burbules
text: I love this place every time I come here. The food is always hot and fresh. Not greasy and very fair portions and prices. I come here every time I visit my parents

name: Nedra Eddins
text: Excellent food, ordered curbside pickup food a little slow arriving but worth the wait.   Large order (over $100) and order was 100% correct! Friendly delivery to the car.

name: Jenna Nicole
text: I LOVE Thai Big bowl! It’s truly great Thai food, it’s so yummy. The minus 1 Star part is for the online ordering portion. I ordered Thai Spring Rolls tonight. It’s pictured below on their menu. Thai spring rolls are different than veggie spring rolls. I was given not spring rolls but rice paper filled spring rolls. I blame their menu for having a picture of something that is not that specific item. Reading through the menu it isn’t very specific that this is different. I’m a little annoyed but I will be back and I’ll know what to order next time...

name: John Clay
text: Big bowl is more than just a restaurant. It's a love language. I've shared its cozy atmosphere and delicious food with friends and family on numerous occasions, each time leaving a bit happier.

name: Tim Busby
text: Great experience!  Presentation and taste was outstanding.  Well priced and treated with the up most respect.  If I lived in the area it would be a weekly stop.

name: Mindy VerHage
text: I ordered delivery from Grubhub.  I had Tom Kha Soup and Larb they were both fabulous.

name: James Lott
text:
The staff was super friendly, and very sweet to our 3 year old.  The food was delicious, and it was a quiet, comfy atmosphere.

Highly recommend the Thai spring rolls and the massaman curry.

name: Michael Chandler
text: Heart lunch at a decent price.  Was just driving through the area and found this gem.

name: David Darby
text: Great lunch place. Probably great for dinner as well. Had Thai spicy basil chicken. Love they use fresh basil. It's obvious from the taste. Not as spicy as I like though but you can ask for chilli paste and they will bring out a caddy with 4 different selections.

name: Samuel Hubbard
text: Good Thai food. Good and fast service.

name: casey smith
text: One of the best Thai places in the area

name: Thai in Alabama
text:
I happened to be in Huntsville and craved for Thai food so much. I decided to give this place a try. Staff were super friendly. I ordered Lad Na. It was so so good! I’m hooked now. Wish I live closer.

The most authentic Thai in town.

name: Angie Jackson
text: My first visit here was wonderful! Quick service, quality Thai food, great prices, and a nice variety served with the lunch specials. Lunches come with a bowl of coconut soup, a small salad, an appetizer of the day, and your entree, all for $8.99. Also, wait staff had proper gloves and face shielding due to the virus. We will definitely be back.

name: William Eden
text: Most authentic Thai restaurant probably in the state! Food is delicious, all the noodle dishes like the pad see ew and drunken noodles are a great choice. The presentation is solid and the atmosphere of the restaurant is enjoyable. If you like Thai food, you have to try big bowl.

name: Amber Litteken
text: Nice quirkey plating! Delicious food and fantastic prices.

name: Jacob York
text: This is where I took my mom for her first time trying Thai cuisine. I had the Panag Curry and she had the garlic chicken.  Very attentive staff, fantasitic coconut soup to start the meal with. My favorite Thai place in the Huntsville area.

name: Erika
text: I loved this place! We did have a slight mixup in the order resulting my entree to be sent back, BUT they were quick to realize their mistake and the food was so good I wasn’t even slightly frustrated. I got the green curry with tofu and it was so tasty and filling. The spring rolls are great too as well as those fried banana roll things. I cannot say enough great things about my experience.

name: Doug Kahn
text: Loved my meal.  Got the ginger chicken lunch box which comes with a salad, a California roll, and rice for about 9 bucks.  It wasn’t too crowded for a Monday during lunchtime.

name: Mary Grayson King
text: ate there the other day and the staff was very friendly and each table was very clean and had hand sanitizer. I got the lunch bento box with a California roll and Pad Thai, it was delicious!

name: Breanna Smith
text: I wish I could give it more stars. I love this place so much! Food is amazing, service is great, prices are good, portions are perfect. We order here almost every week. The curry drunken noodle, panang curry, chicken satay, and all of the noodle soups are our favorites. Also get the ice coffee!

name: Mariana
text: Great food, fast friendly service, will keep going back for lunch.

name: Carrie DeVore
text: Dropping our youngest to Space Camp. Searched Google for Thai near me, 'cause I had a hankering. It had awesome reviews so I placed my order online and wasn't a bit disappointed! Delicious! And so much included in my lunch! Good Pad Thai, rolls with awesome sauce for dipping, soup, salad. Yum! So happy! Will have to order again on Friday when I am back to pick him up! Oh, and the staff was friendly and very sanitary conscience during these Covid times! Thank you, Big Bowl!

name: Rocket City Eats
text: We truly enjoyed this place. The staff was friendly and convenient plus the food was great! What we like the most was it’s location and convenience.  Definitely try their Thai Tea!

name: Jane Hammond
text: Good food. Fresh and flavorful

name: KL
text: Love the Panang, fried rice and drunken noodles as well as gyoza. Well priced and curbside pickup is available. Friendly and prompt service.

name: Donna Malone
text: The food here is excellent and always consistent, with very friendly and personable staff.

name: Brooke Graham
text: We were shopping nearby and caught eye of this restaurant.  I'm pretty knowledgeable on the Huntsville food scene and have never heard of it.  We decided to give it a try, and man, we were not disappointed.  The lunch menu has many good options and at a very affordable price. I had the chicken curry bento box, I couldn't even eat it all and it was priced under 10$.  I grabbed some take out menus to pass out to friends and family - figured this was a new business that needed some good publicity!

name: Clay Weisenberger
text: Have ordered the cashew chicken and the kids always have one of the noodle dishes. The food is always excellent. If you like Asian food that doesn't feel or taste as heavy as Chinese, go here. The service is great, and the food is well presented. If I were to label the food type, it would be more Asian fusion that pure Thai. Our kids love this place. Totally recommend!

name: Brooke Post
text: Delicious every time!

name: Mark Moore
text: This place was excellent. The prices are good and everything we ate was prepared very well. Granted we had noodle dishes but they were very flavorful. The service was top notch and very welcoming. The tea is just the right amount of sweet (for a southerner) and the food was just the right spice. I look forward to trying some of their other dishes.

name: Matt Saund
text: Big bowl? More like Big BET

name: David Kopp
text: I had the drunken noodle chicken for lunch. 👍

name: Bennie Adams
text: Excellent food and service.

name: Juliet King
text: We love 💘 this place.  Everything is delicious

name: Hingelszveld
text: Incredible food with super cute presentation! My drink straw was formed into a rose. I would have taken a picture, but the Spicy Curry Drunken Noodles required an immediate beverage break. Great food and great service!

name: Zigoroph
text: The best Thai Food in Huntsville.

name: Joy Williams
text: Always enjoy the food!

name: Matthew Yearber
text: Fast, friendly and good food.

name: Matthew Yearber
text: Fast, friendly and good food.

name: Amber Litteken
text: Nice quirkey plating! Delicious food and fantastic prices.

name: Shawker 71
text: This is my favorite place for Thai in Huntsville. The Big Drunken Bowl is amazing. They have little banana spring rolls that are delicious as well. I have found nothing here that is not good. Price is very reasonable and the staff are very attentive. Go here.

name: Carlie Villa
text: Love the drunken noodles chicken! Friendly staff too!

name: Wiley Wilson
text: The food here is incredible. Not only is it delicious but it is beautiful! The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. On top of all that, the speed of service is better than some "fast food" establishments in the area. Highly recommend!

name: Nicole Hicks
text: Great atmosphere, wonderful service and delicious food. Will be back, the pan fried chicken is to die for.

name: Joseph Walston
text: Good service. Warm at best sake. Food was good, not the very best thai I have had but good. Nice atmosphere. Nice customers.

name: Casey Aldrup
text: Wonderful! The outside is unassuming, but the interior is very cozy and stylish. The prices are budget-friendly. My husband and I had dinner for under $25 and it was delicious. I had the panang curry and he had the red curry: both were tasty and spicy. We'll be back!

name: Yeffri Sampson
text: I ordered pad thai it was excellent , the staff is friendly and offer good recommendations. a must if you are around the area and craving for asian food.

name: Marc Hinnemann
text:
Great place.
Awsome and authentic food
Good service
Fair pricing

name: Joani Schreiner
text: Our first time here. Amazing fried rice and Thai coffee. All ingredients were fresh, loved the big juicy shrimp. Great atmosphere and the servers were the sweetest!

name: E L
text: Food was excellent! Presentation was beautiful.  You get a mini starter and dessert with a well priced good portion meal. I wish portion size for rice was a bit more. But no complaints here. Will be back

name: Craig Brooks
text: Massamun and Pad Thai were delicious. Service was friendly and attentive. 10-year-old wasn't thrilled with the kids menu, as they don't have chicken fingers or anything. Have a 90 health rating Feb. 2020, which is okay. Would recommend.

name: Megan Turner
text: Ordered the coconut chicken noodle soup.  Love it!  Service is fast and friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone

name: Jade Valentine
text: We love coming to Big Bowl. We drive all the way from Decatur just to eat here. The prices are so reasonable, the portions are huge, and the food is very good, fresh, and hot. It’s also a good place for a vegan or vegetarian. I get the drunken noodles with tofu, or the pad Thai with veggies and tofu. The staff is very nice and the atmosphere is great, tasteful and clean. I can’t think of one thing they should change. Thank you Big Bowl!

name: Funkycybermonkey
text: Great green curry.

name: Olivia Blunder
text: Delicious thai food for a good price, arranged very eye catching. If you want to eat authentic thai spicy you need to ask for it (else spicyness is drastically reduced).

name: MrSupr3me
text: Best pad see u. But do not get beef here its dry and tough. Chicken is great. Sushi is fresh. Would recommend to anyone

name: Lloyd Thompson
text: Very good Thai restaurant with a friendly staff. Clean. Good menu. Great value.

name: Thomas Lawton
text: Incredible Pad Thai. On par with what I've had on the west coast.

name: Curtis Price
text: I've made the Big Bowl a weekly stop after accidentally discovering it while dropping a friend off to work. The decor, like many fine Asian restaurants, reminds you of the 1970s . Yet you are not coming for the decor, but for delicious, modestly priced food. And another plus for the ambiance: it is actually quiet inside; no blaring music. You can hold conversations and - gasp! - actually hear the person you're conversing with. Highly recommended.

name: Cameron Shea
text:
Great Thai food in a small but not tiny venue.

Service is always excellent and friendly, and staff is willing to help out.

The food is quite good, especially when you consider the price. I really enjoy all the types of Drunken Noodles offered here; each kind is delicious and flavorful.

Definitely give it a try!

name: Alex Standridge
text:
My girlfriend and I live in Decatur, but often travel to Madison/Huntsville to eat, as there are more vegan options. For oriental style food Big Bowl is absolutely our favorite. We've been here 4 times now, and it's worth the drive. Excellent price point, with apps typically $4.99 and entrees typically $9.99. Food is very very good, although it is Americanized Thai, and portions are large.

Overall highly reccomend this place. Give it a shot, you'll be happy you did.

name: Robert Voitle
text: Big bowl of a nice mid-price Thai restaurant with all the traditional dishes you would expect from a Thai restaurant. While none of the dishes stand out as spectacular, none of them have been terrible either. The staff is friendly, if not a little persistent, and the atmosphere is relaxed and reasonably quiet. Modern relaxed pop music plays just a little too loud for whispered conversation.

name: Tiffany Cope
text: SO good! The good was fantastic. The service was speedy. The staff was friendly. The prices are good. Great experience, will definitely be back.

name: Steve Mittwede
text: Great food and pleasant staff.

name: G Thompson
text: The food was good. The place was quiet. And the service was exceptional

name: K Goodloe
text: I picked up a take out order. The staff was friendly. The food was great.  Everything I needed was in the bag. I will go again.

name: Yeffri Sampson
text: I ordered pad thai it was excellent , the staff is friendly and offer good recommendations. a must if you are around the area and craving for asian food.

name: Daryl B
text: Amazing little Thai place. Great food and friendly staff. I always make a stop when in Huntsville

name: Kou Lor
text: Dishes were unappetizing, pad Thai was plain in taste, Special sauces was very watery on pad thai dish, it was very close to being soggy. Fried rice was very light in color and taste burnt every bite, customer services was okay, everything could have been better. Very disappointed 🤬👎👎👎👎👎👎👎

name: Paul Hudson
text: I've been here a few times and gotten carry out a few more. Their pad Thai, drunken noodles, and curries are all absolutely great

name: Tamara Spadafore
text:
Amazing food, amazing service!! Hard to get a good review from me, so you know it's good!

Update ... Came back again. Delicious again!!! Mild Curry is amazing as well as Rama Chicken. Love it! Definitely eat in though. You get a little salad and dessert with your meal! So so good

name: p y
text: Good Thai food and hospitality

name: B
text: Drunken dishes are yummy.

name: Kathleen Skemp Zimmerman
text: This is an excellent, inexpensive and delicious restaurant to eat at for lunch. For less than $10 you can have soup, appetizer, small salad and entree. The Green Curry Chicken is amazing. All items on the menu are well described, which is often not the case at a Thai restaurant. The staff is polite and attentive. I’m looking forward to trying it for supper.

name: kristina Crutchfield
text: Omg amazing!!! Great thai food

name: John Ingram
text: Good Pad Thai, but I wish there would have been some spicy sauce to go with it.

name: Sheila
text: The food is authentic, flavorful and creatively plated - presentation is everything. Good lunch proportion at a good price.

name: Adam “Oldman” Martin
text: It's rare to find an authentic Asian flavor experience like Big Bowl in Huntsville. Big Bowl is unique, fast, and puts together a satisfying dish that stands apart from the usual fare.

name: Sydni Meade
text: Their rude I wouldn’t even come to this restaurant to sit down and eat. I’ve been here twice picking up orders. And one of the waitress doing too much for no reason trying to give orders when she’s not even in charge and also being in people business smdh.

name: Doux Owner
text: Friendly environment, amazing food, low prices.

name: Andrea Williams
text: Service was decently fast, but the appetizers arrived with the main dishes. The food itself was pretty solid, but nothing I'd go out of the way for. If you're in the neighborhood, give it a try, but there are better Thai options in the area.

name: Megan Ford
text: This place is consistent and pretty good (I come from LA where the food is just better all around, but by Huntsville standards this is good). The one bummer is that the service can really lag sometimes when they are busy. So it’s probably not a good choice if you’re pressed for time. The lunches are a nice combo.

name: Cory Williams
text: Great food and service! Portions are generous and priced reasonably. I'm usually critical of Thai restaurants and have nothing bad to say about this one.

name: Amanda Warner
text: My husband and I visit this little restaurant every time we go to Huntsville. It's a precious little place with amazing food and a quiet environment. I love it

name: Amber Roberson
text: They have great food and it's well prices!

name: Chad Holland
text: Not good. We waited a while to even be acknowledged at the table by a server. The drinks all came out flat. When we notified the server she brought back a can. The water tasted weird. We had a party of 4 and the dinners came out separately and spaced apart. By the time the last person got their meal the first 2 people were almost done eating. The food was bland and not at all what is expected from a Thai restaurant. We won't be going back.

name: Bob Croyle
text: Delicious food and nice portion size for the money. The coconut soup is perfect and the panang curry was spot on.  I would eat there anytime.

name: RACHELLE JORDAN
text: Try the drunken big bowl with SMALL RICE NOODLES.. MAKE SURE YOU SAY THAT AN A SWEET THIA TEA.. FOOD WAS GOOD BUT THE PEOPLE COULD BE MORE FRIENDLIER I FELT RUSHED

name: HSV 702
text: After reading so many positive reviews about Big Bowl, we decided to give it a whirl today and were pleasantly surprised.  Things were relatively slow when we showed up for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  We were seated immediately and were given a small bowl of soup and our drink order was taken.  As soon as the drinks were delivered, we placed our order from the lunch menu, which may be limited compared to the dinner menu.  I ordered the Thai ice tea and Pad Thai chicken and my wife ordered the Big Bowl Tom Yum Kai Sab noodle soup.  Our meals were delivered in a relatively short time and were very good.  From start to finish, we were both very impressed with our visit to Big Bowl … the restaurant (and bathroom) were spotless, the wait staff was friendly/attentive, the meal presentation was perfect and the service was quick.  Pad Thai is my favorite dish so I eat it at almost every Thai restaurant I visit and this version was very good but not great … it seemed like something was missing.  However, I still give Big Bowl high marks and will eat here again so I recommend you give it a chance.  My compliments to Big Bowl – you guys are fantastic at what you do.

name: Ann Session
text: Great Thai food! I recently moved to Pensacola where good Thai is non existent. Being from Cali, Big Bowl is like what we have on the West Coast.

name: Nick
text: Great food good service and clean!

name: Alicia Jurkovac
text: Very quick for ordering to-go. The rice was over cooked, but not a deal breaker. Satisfied overall.

name: Dorothy Peters
text:
Big Bowl Thai is hands down the best Thai food restaurant in Huntsville so far.  It's a nice cozy atmosphere, perfect for a date night!

Food: 4 of 5
Atmosphere: 4 of 5
Service: 4 of 5
I would recommend this place: for a date night!

I've been to every Thai food place in Huntsville and this one is the best so far.  I've had the Spicy Thai Basil & Drunken Noodles here and both are great, though the drunken noodles win by a smidge in my book!  My friends also recommend the green curry.  The food was well cooked and just the right amount of spicy.  You can also request whatever level of spiciness suites your fancy.  Each meal usually comes with a side salad and an extra treat (we've gotten a spring roll & a friend banana as an extra and both were delicious).  The service is also excellent!  Definitely an all around great place!

name: John Bowdre
text:
Lunch was delicious, portions generous, and a great value. Service was a bit lacking. The food took a while to arrive, but it was hot and fresh so I can forgive that. Over the course of my meal, however, I completely drained my water (and then also the remaining ice as it melted) without an offer for a refill. Keeping the water topped up should really be automatic.

Still, the food was great, so I'm sure I'll return.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: Great food and solid prices! Service was top notch! Would go back many times!

name: John Rajan
text:
SOMEONE AMONGST THE STAFF AT THIS RESTAURANT MAY BE STEALING CREDIT CARD IDENTITIES.

I have been at this restaurant three times and the food is really great.  However the last time I went to this restaurant I am concerned and strongly suspect that someone among the staff stole my credit card Identity.   Immediately after visiting this restaurant on a Tuesday afternoon a few months back, someone began using my credit card for online purchases.  One purchase was $500 from a travel agency and another purchase was for a $200 gift card from a company that gives gift cards to restaurants.

name: S Fury
text: Very good food and fresh tasting. Presentation was pretty good, portions were a little small, but the food was so tasty I didnt mind.

name: Steve Smith
text: Great food!!

name: Ross Roden (Non-Tron)
text: Big bowl is a constant visit for me and my friends. They have a decently sized menu, and wonderful authentic Thai food. The lunch Bento boxes are also a deal that can’t be beat!

name: Chris Hunsberger
text: Food was pretty good.  We had 4 different dishes.  Everyone enjoyed.  Service has a little room for improvement but not bad.

name: James Larsen
text: This place is a real find. I’m normally quite leery about trying Asian cuisine in a strip mall. Coworkers and I gave this a shot based off of of the reviews and we were all glad we did! The service was very prompt and courteous. The food was delicious, and what could be the best part about eating here was the price. Very affordable and very tasty! You will not be disappointed if you come here.

name: shasta kimeo
text: Friendly and courteous staff.  Awesome food and great atmosphere.  Generous portions for lunch.

name: Burr Butler
text: Amazing! My brother brought me here to try Thai for the first time, and I've been hooked. Everything about this restaurant is amazing. The staff is super sweet, the place is cute and clean, the service is fast, and the food is incredible. Definitely recommend the green curry!

name: Hannah Varian
text: Awesome food! Green Curry Chicken at lunch is great! Service is pleasant and they don't bother you too often which is nice to be able to enjoy conversation while you eat. My husband tried the iced Thai tea and that was really good!

name: Brian Dunaway
text: This place blew me away. I really wasn't expecting for it to be this good but it was amazing. Everyone was so nice and it was quick for lunch. I'll definitely be back.

name: Kendal
text: This place has great food for reasonable prices. It's definitely a go to for a week day night, yum!

name: A M
text: Just had lunch and the price and serving size was amazing! 7.99 for a soup, salad, app and meal. All were smaller portions, but more than enough to fill you up and give you variety. Tasted excellent as well. This is going to be a new lunch spot!

name: Delaney Alexander
text: This place was wonderful!! Food was so good and the service was great!!

name: Heath Skelton
text: Really good Thai food with generous quantities. Service is hit-or-miss in my experience. My latest experience was fantastic, they brought out a few jars of chili sauce and flakes that allowed me to make my Pad Thai to my own preference of spiciness. Really cool!

name: Eddie Littrell
text: One of my favorite places for green curry.  Tofu option for vegetarians is greatly appreciated. Tastes fantastic!

name: Eric Patterson
text: This is the best Thai in Huntsville. It's a small mom and pop shop. The service is very friendly and prompt. My favorite dish so far has been the mild chicken curry. The lunch special comes with a small salad and two spring rolls. Very reasonable prices.

name: Guy Incognito
text: The smaller dining area doesn't skimp on a great contemporary feel.  I think they may have phased sushi off of the menu, but there are still many meals to choose from.  I had the green curry.  It wasn't overly sweet nor overly spicy.  Very nice staff and great prices for what you receive.  I will definitely return.   Oh, even better lunch prices, too.

name: Naomi Cooper
text: Great Food, Greeted immed, Great Prices, Had my first Fried Bananas.......MMM Good

name: Brooke Harbison
text: Great lunch menu and quick service. Food was excellent

name: Nubian D
text: Another two time visit well attempted second visit. This is the only reason why I gave them 4 stars versus 5. My first visit there was for a late lunch, my meal was superb! So, superb I asked for the menu to order dinner to go home for later that evening. I dont think you can choose wrong on this menu. I ordered the mild curry chicken for lunch and took home ginger chicken for dinner. Well on my 2 attempt and very disappointing attempt I went to the nail salon right next door to get my timely pedicure. I figured after my pedicure I'd pick up an early dinner to take out to go home and eat. People were inside consuming their meals and the door was open, so I walked in and began to ask for a menu to order food to go. I was sadly informed they close every day Mon-Fri at 3pm-4pm of course I quickly looked at my watch and saw it was 315pm. I said well can I place an order to go not to dine in and she kindly told me no. I walked back out to see if maybe I missed the sign on the door in eager to please my palate. But NOPE no sign! Nothing by the posted hours, no temporary window sign, no sidewalk sign NOTHING! I was even more upset because this is all I wanted and I was only 10 minutes away from hotel hut there was no way I was waiting another 45 minutes to order after being pampered. I walked in and stated I'm not from the area and I'm not sure how many regular customers you have that just know you're closed for an hour daily but it would be nice if you placed a sign on the door for notice to the public. Of course she just smiled and said thank you. I was chasing that specific Thai flavor and just couldn't have it and it was just very disappointing.

name: Jenna Wilson
text: This place is wonderful. I am so glad that Madison has great Thai food to offer. Very Nice servers that are super helpful. Impressed with the prices. Food is always very good and fresh.

name: Tanisha Hampton
text: Absolutely love the atmosphere and the staff here. Food is always delicious and appropriately priced. Great experience every time!

name: Stephen Kirby
text: The best Thai tea and the best pad Thai in Huntsville. I go here every week and it's never been to loud to get some good work done.

name: Hailey Watts
text: My favorite place to eat! Waitresses are so sweet too

name: Kyle C
text: The food is good.  The service is good.  There is a good deal of competition for Thai food or Asian food in general but this place is a competitor and for this level a relatively inexpensive one at that.

name: Ashley Petty
text: So good! The food was so fresh and the service was phenomenal! I had the basil chicken and my husband had the green curry. I think this is my new favorite place!

name: J Simpson
text: Great place with great service. Well priced and the portions are generous.

name: Lori TenHopen
text: Delicious...very fresh veggies, cooked perfectly, and amazing flavor!  The staff is very friendly.  Highly recommend!

name: Trey Franklin
text: One of my favorite Asian restaurants in Huntsville. Good prices, quick service, and most importantly it's very good food. It can be a bit tight during peak hours though.

name: Mr Ed Stewart
text:
Very good food 😋
Slow service 😭

name: capntrauma
text: Ate there for the first time yesterday. I am not sure how long it has been open. Loved the coconut soup. It has been awhile since I had some authentic Thai and that hit the spot.  This was before we even ordered. The food was very good. Price was just right. Portions were good. Go today!

name: Neal Martin
text: Good value for the money.  Fast  polite service. Needs a broader menu.

name: Mik S
text: Love it... but they got a 75 on health inspection .  They need to do better

name: Eric Leavitt
text: I love small Thai restaurants like this. Nice and cozy, friendly staff, good prices with good quality. I always get pad thai at Thai places, and they make it like I like it, plus you get some extras on the side (including a little banana desert roll thing that was really good). I also got the Thai tea, which was excellent. Glad I checked it out and will be back.

name: Malcolm Jessup, Jr.
text: Great food and a great small place to dine in

name: Matthew Urbanic
text: Nice place, great service. Food is true-to-form. Wasn’t too crowded for a lunch crowd. Decor is pretty and calming.

name: Nicolas d'Avout
text: Pretty Thai girls and good food. What more could a man ask for?

name: Evan S
text: Big Bowl is a quiet restaurant with a good small feeling atmosphere.  Of all the times I've been, our food has always been served within 5-10 minutes of ordering.  You get a large portion of food for usually around $7 to $8.  The waiters have always been down to earth and very nice.  Overall, I would totally recommend going to Big Bowl if you're craving some Thai food.

name: Brittany Clifford
text: Fantastic food, fresh, friendly and attentive staff. Recommend over and over

name: Harrison Divoll
text: Excellent food, great service.

name: Lindsay Wheeler
text: I love this place! I try to bring all my friends here whenever possible! I get the yellow curry, it's the best in the whole area!

name: kelby becker
text: The food was awesome. And I'm a picky eater. Great staff. I will definitely be back.

name: Richard York
text: Nice quiet spot to have lunch or dinner.. The food is great and the service is always quick and friendly.

name: Shama Patel
text: I love all their curry dishes.  Awesome Thai flavors!

name: ashtonauts
text: Delivers on its name

name: Lane Martin
text: Very good Thai. Portions were large.

name: stacy willingham
text: Great food, great service. Highly recommend eating here!

name: William Burke
text: Really good Thai food with fast and friendly service.

name: Vaibhav Menon
text: My favorite place to eat and grab take out from. Affordable, delicious, and generous portions.

name: Geneva Limbaugh
text: Attentive cheerful service! The food was very good as well.

name: Matthew Henry
text: Vegan Friendly - The spring-rolls are fantastic and the tofu is significantly better than most (very meaty). I'll be making this place a regular stop.

name: Earth to Adam
text: Wonderful! We ate there for lunch today. Our waitress was actually from Thailand and was really sweet. The food was fresh and delicious   so we will be making the drive from Florence more often.

name: Phoenix C
text: This is our go to Thai restaurant. Very tasty, authentic dishes coupled with friendly service keep bringing us back here. The restaurant is cozy and clean. They are very popular on weekdays at lunch time but we van usually get a table. Our favorite dishes: drunken chicken fried noodles, penang curry, and Big Bowl noodle soup.

name: robert pitts
text: I always try something new and have not been disappointed.

name: Stephen Mayo
text: This is literally the best Thai food within 100 miles. The customer service is always extremely polite and friendly. I have visited so often that everyone knows my customized dishes! This location is a must visit.

name: Ryan McKannan
text: Meal was alright, beef was very dry. Music was pleasant, pricing was reasonable though not as much food as other places for the same amount. Good quality tho.

name: Richard Van Puymbrouck
text: Very great service and authentic food.

name: Mark B
text: Awesome!

name: Charlotte M. Ellett (Charlaxy)
text: Pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and presentation. Their menu is succinct and focused. I had a Thai dinner without too many carbs, because they served the rice on the side. Everything tasted great. This is possibly the best restaurant in this shopping center.

name: Eric Mills
text: Tasty and filling, but not bloating

name: Robert Callis
text: My wife and I love this place. Easily some of the best food in the Huntsville area. Try their Big Bowl Drunken Noodles for a nice twist on a classic Thai dish. The banana spring rolls will blow your mind. Haven't managed to find anything on the menu that isn't great.

name: Michael Spiceland
text: Fantastic food and fantastic prices.  I have been jealous of other cities for having low cost, fantastic thai.  Now we do too!  My wife and I both enjoyed our meals today and I'm going to have to see if I can resist going back tomorrow.  The food was super tasty and looked to be fresh and nutritious.  Lunch came with a soup and an appetizer of the day which were both great.  I had a chicken dish and the chicken was white meat, trimmed well, and tender and cooked well.  The service was quick and friendly as well.

name: K. Girod
text: Big Bowl has a great menu and the food is consistently delicious. Love the curry, wonton and crab Rangoon especially. Their plate presentation is beautiful too. Definitely recommend.

name: Michael Spiceland
text: Fantastic food and fantastic prices.  I have been jealous of other cities for having low cost, fantastic thai.  Now we do too!  My wife and I both enjoyed our meals today and I'm going to have to see if I can resist going back tomorrow.  The food was super tasty and looked to be fresh and nutritious.  Lunch came with a soup and an appetizer of the day which were both great.  I had a chicken dish and the chicken was white meat, trimmed well, and tender and cooked well.  The service was quick and friendly as well.

name: Mark B
text: Awesome!

name: K. Girod
text: Big Bowl has a great menu and the food is consistently delicious. Love the curry, wonton and crab Rangoon especially. Their plate presentation is beautiful too. Definitely recommend.

name: Richard Van Puymbrouck
text: Very great service and authentic food.

name: Amy Baynes
text: Visited during a spontaneous excursion. Generous amount of food for great prices. Love their iced coffee. Will be coming back!

name: Harish Adhikesavan
text: Very good ambience and service. The Thai tea is a must try. But the food sometimes tastes stale. The chicken doesn't taste good most of the time.

name: Saksham Goyal
text: Excellent service, food was ok (knowing what real Thai food tastes like after living in Thailand for 16 years)

name: Southern Sky
text: We come here for the atmosphere as well as for a no- guilt meal. Food is always incorporated with vegetables and salad. The place is small but modern and uncluttered. Great music in the background. I give it 4 stars..waitresses tend to forget easily what you asked for...like sugar for tea or drink refills. Slow in giving your tickets. But food so far was great..try the green curry or Panang or the Drunk Noodles or Cashew Chicken. They also have bento boxes such as teriyaki chicken and salmon. They typically serve each meal with coconut infused soup and egg rolls or banana rolls. I think the food is superb but service can be improved...

name: Jonathan Powell (JP)
text: Great little Thai place! Huntsville can't have enough great Thai restaurants if you ask me! Friendly service too!

name: Cady Weldon
text:
PEOPLE WITH ALLERGIES, BEWARE!

We told our server that my boyfriend is allergic to coconut and she assured us that what we ordered would not contain any. When she brought out our plate we noticed what looked like a small eggroll on the side. Since it wasn’t mentioned as a side with the dish we ordered, we asked what it was before we tried it. She said it was just a fried banana, so we tried it (didn’t care for it, but that’s beside the point). Fast forward to half an hour later when we’re standing in Target and I realize my boyfriend has broken out in hives. I scoured the menu and found out that that fried banana (which was actually under the dessert menu and, again, not mentioned anywhere under the dish we ordered) also contained—SURPRISE!—coconut.

They are so unbelievably lucky that the hives weren’t more severe or we would have absolutely pursued legal action. I am beyond appalled at their complete lack of concern for their patrons’ health.

text: Was traveling through Semmes and stopped here for lunch, what a great restaurant! Great service and wonderful food, highly recommend it!!

name: Clif Brownlee
text: First off we try to support local restaurants when we can. These small businesses have suffered due to COVID. So please support these small businesses. This restaurant is amazing. The service was fast and friendly. The food was incredible. The appetizer sampler we had was a good way to sample the appetizers to know what you will like on your next visit, and you will want to come back. I had the pineapple fried rice and my wife had the sabai sushi roll. Both of our entrees tasted great. If your looking for some great Thai food try Sabai.

name: Anonymous Friend
text: I had the duck curry. It was soooo AMAZING! I don't think I can come up with words for how tender, deliciously spicy, and just divine it was.

name: Alisha Rogers
text: I can try to explain how amazing this food is, though you will have to experience it for yourself. There are so many Menu options, but more than that the food is genuinely Thai. The owner, who I absolutely adore, is from Thailand and she told me she never cooks anything out of a can, everything is fresh to the table. She actually imports certain foods from Thailand because she wants her food to be as authentic as possible. And you can tell Her and her daughters make the food with love. I hate that the pandemic lessened  their business. If I could do it myself, I would keep them in business every day because of how amazing this food is and how genuinely sweet everyone is when you go. The restaurant is nice, has simple, elegant decor, very cozy. The booths are very comfortable. And everything is so well sanitized. My sister was visiting from Virginia on leave and I wanted to take her out for lunch before she had to go back and so we decided to try Sabai. I am so glad that we did. My sister and I fell in love with this place so we decided to take our mother there for her birthday that’s coming up so we could all celebrate together before she headed back to Norfolk. My mother and grandmother loved the food, and they are very picky eaters so that speaks volumes about the quality. I have many friends and family that I’ll be bringing here. You have to try the coconut soup and fried cheesecake. It’s basically heaven. 😊

text: will never order from this place again! I ordered the ribeye bento box, which included: fried rice(my choice), ribeye steak, veggies & 4 pieces of sushi. All of this was included...but....the steak was covered in about an inch of soy sauce so I couldnt really taste the steak. The rice was rubbery. The tempura shrimp was also rubbery. The veggies were deep fried...ALL OF THEM! Speaking of veggies, there was one deep fried piece of broccoli, one large deep fried onion ring and one large deep fried piece of green pepper. Seriously. Now to the sushi: the rice was way over cooked and the veggies inside were not fresh at all. And what restaurant places sushi on top of wasabi???? Not everyone likes wasabi so to place every sushi piece on top of it...come on. I do not recommend this place at all. DO NOT EAT HERE!!

name: Lax Factoid
text:
Their Japanese / Sushi might be great, but their Thai is -- to put it politely -- one step below the quality you'll find in your local freezer section.

We've only had Toke's Thai food, so this review pertains ONLY to their Thai offerings, which are not very good at all. The restaurant is very nice, and many other reviews are very favorable, so I would presume those are for their Japanese and Sushi cuisine. Definitely PASS on the Toke's Thai food. We had three different entrees and all of them were well below-average. We're transplanted Thai fanatics, and have eaten at many quality Thai restaurants around the country, including in Bangkok (Thailand). If you're hankering for very good, authentic Thai food, we highly recommend KATI Thai by Noccalula Falls in Gadsden. It's worth the trip, as their food is just about as good as any NYC or Portland Thai village restaurant you're likely to find. It's a little hole-in-the-wall, but the food is top notch.

We'll sample Toke's other offerings, and will record a separate review for them just to give Toke a fair shake, but if you're looking for even modestly decent Thai, Toke should definitely NOT come to mind.
